title: Missing documentation for creating Ignition-compatible docker containers

content.raw:
My apologies if I’m just missing something, but I have not been able to find any information/documentation yet for how to create a docker container compatible with Ignition and CloudSim. Following the steps on [#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/SystemSetupDocker](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/SystemSetupDocker) , you can get a docker container containing the default Ignition subt environment. Obviously this docker container can be extended to contain competitor code as before, but it is not clear to me how this will actually be run in the online environment.

From looking at the cloudsim submission portal, it seems each robot is given its own docker container. Since the robot types and configurations are selected in the portal, I'm assuming cloudsim takes care of running the `ign launch virtual_stix.ign -v 4` command \(or similar\) with the corresponding robot configurations, which will spawn the actual robots.

After that point, I am lost. Specifically, I’m wondering:

* How should the controller for each robot be launched? Is there a launch command which is run on each docker container by cloudsim, or should this happen somehow by each container on its own at startup?
* Can multiple robots in the system use the same docker image? \(i.e. does cloudsim somehow identify to the container by name which robot is being spawned?\)
